alert.note: Alert for Southeast Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:16PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cherokee, Clay and southeastern Monroe Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 616 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles west of Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek to 8 miles north of Morganton. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Andrews, Murphy, Hayesville, Nantahala Lake, Tusquitee, Hiawasse Dam, Marble, Brasstown, Shooting Creek and Citico. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southwestern North Carolina...and east Tennessee.
